newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Pertamina says Dumai fire does not affect output.
newsitem.headline: Pertamina says Dumai fire does not affect output.

text.p: Indonesia's state-owned oil company Pertamina said on Monday the fire at its Dumai refinery in South Sumatra last week did not affect production.
"Friday's fire did not affect operations or production as it was put out an hour later," the official, who declined to be identified, told Reuters by telephone from the refinery.

The official denied a Kompas newspaper report that the fire was caused by a boiler which exploded. "It's not the boiler which caught fire but a tube which is used in oil processing," said the official. He declined to give further details.
Kompas said the explosion in the 125,000 barrels per day refinery had triggered panic among local residents because it could be heard as far as 25 km (16 miles) away.
The Dumai refinery, one of the biggest owned by Pertamina, was inaugurated by President Suharto in 1978.
Pertamina shut down the refinery's crude distillation unit on February 22 for scheduled maintenance and re-started it on March 21. -- Jakarta Newsroom + 6221 384-6364
